website_summaries.verdict: Top-selling ballpoint ink pens by a trusted brand that top our list when it comes to value. A great choice for budget-hunters and consumers who use ink pens frequently.
pros: Affordable, classic ball-point ink pens that write smoothly
See-through barrels make it easy to see when ink levels are low
Available in black and blue ink, plus they come in inexpensive multi-packs that are perfect for buying in bulk
cons: Some reports of faulty pens that leaked ink or dried out prematurely
Some users wish the ink were a bit darker

customer_reviews.title: You Can Write Home About These Pens!
customer_reviews.text: I always snap up these pens whenever they go on sale. I have no idea why they do go on sale because they’re excellent pens, so there shouldn’t be extras lying around. These are thins pens—thinner and lighter than most disposable pens—and they’re very easy to hold. They have a smooth roller ball, which is why they write so easily without any skips or blots. The ink is also a nice color—a light black or dark grey. If you need a solid, dependable, and enjoyable disposable pen, these are absolutely excellent choices. If you find them on sale, then you should absolutely take advantage of your good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Therese M Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Not the best pens...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a 4/5 star rating for ONLY one reason.....the cheap price. Otherwise, don't expect much out of them, the quality isn't the best and many of them don't even work or jam up. But again, if you don't want to spend a lot of money on pens you can always go this route.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Smooth but not dark enough.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought that the pen doesn't write smoothly, but it does. But to do so I had to write in larger letters than I am used to. The biggest fault with this pen is that the ink is just not dark enough. It's too light. I think that's why I started writing in bigger letters to compensate for it, and found that it does write smoothly at least. So the pen is usable, but it doesn't make you want to pick it up and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Jean Ok

customer_reviews.title: do not work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a box of 60 bic xtra life pens. almost the entire box of 60 do not write. I have had them sitting on my desk and I just opened them the other day because my other box of 60 that I ordered a long time ago finally ran out. I grabbed the 1st one, tried to write something and nothing. tried some scribbling and nothing. grabbed another pen, same thing. and another and so on and so forth. this is the 1st time I have had to write a bad review on a product I have ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Starcevich

customer_reviews.title: Great Pens
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of BIC Round Stic Xtra Life Ballpoint Pen, Medium Point (1.0mm), Black, 36-Count. I've been using this product for years and love it. They are easy to write with and the price is good. The pens are comfortable in my hand. I have arthritis in my hands and writing used to trigger pain in my hands. I don't get pain in my hands with these pens. I've bought the blue ink pens and the black ink pens. Both are good. I prefer the black for adding entries in my check book because I find it easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lakes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: All around the worst pen (60 pens) I ever purchased. In my case the ink would simply not flow out properly leaving me with barely legible script. In other reviews, they leak. Pathetic. Amazon offered me a refund and into the garbage they went. Case closed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smith

customer_reviews.title: theres some pens, and a box
customer_reviews.text: in fact the pens come inside the box. smart placement. and theres ink inside the pen. what a smooth vessel. caps are included. there's even a logo, for those who are into that sort of thing. all in all, a wise purchase. now i just have to think of something that i need to use paper for. im obsessed with pens. always have been. all varieties. i love office supplies. the smell of office supply stores. they should market that scent for an air freshener. what?!? they should.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you need a ballpoint and not smeary-ink flow pens
customer_reviews.text: Mostly we keep these on hand for signing documents or filling out forms or envelopes that we want to be sure will not smear as those more-modern flowing gel point (or whatever they are called: easy-flow ink?) pens sometimes do. Occasionally some of these ball point pens are a little difficult to get the ink flowing, but numerous squiggles on a pad of paper usually do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs

customer_reviews.title: They last forever!
customer_reviews.text: I truly love these pens. I bought this exact box of pens years ago and just now decided to write a review. They are great because they last forever. One pen will last an entire semester at school even when you are writing constantly. The only down side to this is that you may lose your pen halfway through the semester and need to get another one! But these pens are overall the best I have used not just because of their price but the quality. They dont smear and they last forever like an actual expensive pen should.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: If you want to get stain.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a server and bought this thinking it was a good buy but ended up regretting. Everyday 4-8 pens will always pop. It ruined my pants, shirts. Now I had to buy new uniform and pens
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Great product, poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: I love Bic and all their products. These pens are cheap, write well and last for a while. This was great value for the price. I removed a star only because of the packaging. The box it was stored in was crushed and the pens were just all over the package. I can’t store these pens in the box now which is inconvenient because I’m definitely not using all 60 at once. I just wish it was packaged better.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great pens at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was so thrilled to find this bulk package of pens! These pens aren't fancy; but the write well! When our church was doing a school supply drive to send overseas with a missionary I started looking for the best buy I could find. Normally I buy several packages of pens from the big box store. But this blew me away with the value. And since everything is packaged in one box; it saves shipping space. I'm so happy to send not just more pens; but good quality pens!
customer_reviews.author: Janaya

customer_reviews.title: 1st box was great. Second box not a sir pen worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 boxes of these pens. 1st box was great. Second box not a sir pen worked. 36 out of 36 fail! Ok maybe I exaggerated. I stopped checking the pens at probably the 20th pen. Tossed the rest. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, lots of ink, and I won’t cry and/or want to punch my co-workers if they steal one from me because I have like 50 more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy to see why the BIC Round Stic Xtra Life ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to see why the BIC Round Stic Xtra Life Ball Pen is the #1 selling ball pen in the country. As the mayor of Kansas City, I use it to sign all my important municipal orders and legal documents. Come to think of it, KC is #1 in something too: storage space. Imagine how many of these BIC Stics you could store in all of Kansas City’s world-leading underground storage, warehousing, and office space. One note on the pens: the Medium Points aren’t refillable, but KC storage spaces sure are.
customer_reviews.author: Mayor Sly James

customer_reviews.title: It's a box of pens
customer_reviews.text: It's a box of pens. Like, comparing it to high class pens, maybe it deserves a one star review... But, if you are aware it's just a box of standard, cheap BIC pens.... I think you'll be very happy with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kristenS

customer_reviews.title: Buying in bulk
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pens due to the fact that I don't have the time anymore to shop at STAPLES here in Los Angeles,CA. The lines are always way too long.. This was a decent purchase and so far I haven't had any problems as of yet? I have six employees and two additional business partners. We are always losing pens.. So I pass these out to employees by two a week.. This was a outstanding value as far as I can tell . Our local CVS sells ink pens for 6,00 for 5..Or you can always drive over to Walmart/Target for office supplies? Either way some things are better bought in bulk and this is one of them!
customer_reviews.author: khristina jackson

customer_reviews.title: What happened.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great cheap buy..... I was wrong. I had two I'm my pocket for less than a minutes and the ink ran out ruining my clothes. I don't know if this is a faulty box because bic brand is usually good but these pens are a waste of money I have so many I can't use. As soon as you take them out the box the explode. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: michelle thompson

customer_reviews.title: stick with Papermate
customer_reviews.text: Enough pens to last awhile. My house bound mom loves to write in her journal and always uses up pens. These write well but she says that every once in awhile, ink won't come out until you scribble on a scratch paper. I usually buy her Papermate and will probably go back to that brand.
customer_reviews.author: AnneM

customer_reviews.title: These pens are AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pens for my delivery job as we lose pens all the time. This is what you need to know: They are painfully difficult to write with for long periods. You have to press down hard, and it does strain your hand. The head / ink dries up FAST, these pens do not last very long at all. Don't expect to use one longer than a week. Beyond that, I know they are cheap as hell, but the quality is just absolute trash.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Whoever shipped this box to me is an idiot
customer_reviews.text: This is how the box came, I didn’t open it. Somehow I got 59 pens instead of 60 even though I definitely bought them new. The pen quality is pretty much what you pay for so look at how cheap this is compared to other pens and you’ll have a pretty good idea of what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jackson

customer_reviews.title: amazing sheerness!!
customer_reviews.text: LOL i dunno why these amazon reviews have a "sheerness" rating request for everything? Anyways, do u have kids? Do u NEVER seem to be able to find a pen even though u bought a pack like this 3 months ago? yeah, thats what happens here, so I was just like BUMP THIS and bought this 60 pack and threw 1/2 in my desk & the other half in my wife's. I'm sure we'll still need to buy another box in 3 months as the pen eating goblin's seem to always be hungry!
customer_reviews.author: SatanKitty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pen for convenience!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of cheap ballpoint pens, however, they cannot be beat for convenience. They write on a variety of surfaces (gel pens don't like glossy paper), and cost so little that I don't mind losing them. So, for my desk I use more expensive pens, but these cheap ballpoints I buy to have extra pens in the car, my pocket at events (where I am very likely to lose it!), or any other situation that I need a pen but may drop/misplace it, these work great!!
customer_reviews.author: Roget

customer_reviews.title: Decent Pen for the price
customer_reviews.text: They're okay, not great, but not bad. They're good for the price for sure. I prefer my pens juicier, but you can't have everything. And, these weren't actually FOR me, they were for my husband to use when he's taking notes during meetings (he works from home), and he thinks they're "fine". They do what he asks of them until they run out of ink, so they're "good pens". Vendor delivered in a timely fashion and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pens.
customer_reviews.text: As picky as I am with what I write with, I’m pretty basic. I love these pens and prefer them over gel pens and the other fancy ones. This is a lot of pens for a small cost. Got me through 2 years of college so far. I am a communications & journalism major so I write a lot. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Liv Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, excellent value. You can’t beat the price and every pen I’ve used in the box (probably 20-30 of them so far) work immediately and seem to last. Bottom line it’s a cheap pen- they feel and appear that way but they certainly serve their purpose as a disposable pen at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Markyyy

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pens. They will always be 5 stars. If BIC ceases making them, I will not five-star another pen EVER. Great value for the price. Large boxes of the only 5 star pens ever made. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kenna Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I recently got these yesterday and tried them out. I absolutely love these ballpoint pens! I have been using gel pens but I realized that I love these because they are smaller! I wasn't sure if they would be comfortable but they are (especially for my healed sprained wrist). I mainly got these to try out pen drawings, and writing. I love it for both! and I love that it comes in a 60 pack that way it DOES last a long while. I love that the ink isn't too thick like a gel pen because I feel like I can write more with it! Overall, I would recommend these to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe M.

customer_reviews.title: Not A Bargain At Any Price
customer_reviews.text: Should be called Xtra LiTe: The ink is so pastel that it's extremely difficult to read whatever has been written. (good for spies, maybe.)

customer_reviews.title: Clogs easily
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Bic pens and found them to be a very reliable, quality product for the price. I bought this box because it was a good price for a lot of pens. However, these pens are frustrating to use because they clog and won't write until you scratch it around on another piece of paper until the ink starts flowing again. I use these to do crossword puzzles and have to do this several times while doing each puzzle. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Bic’s are the traditional pens we like
customer_reviews.text: These right with ease. I hope in the future the deliverer will RING THE BELL and not just leave packages out in the open for all to see and take.. not sure I want them delivering My packages if they can’t alert me it’s on my porch, which; by the way has a large side niche where no one can see. Bit oh no they leave on deck in front of the door. That’s a no-no But still they can ring the RING THE BELL. Maybe we can put some place on a profile no dogs and bell works.
customer_reviews.author: Weize

customer_reviews.title: Basic, thin lines. Good basic pen
customer_reviews.text: These pens put out very little ink and creates a faint marking, which is fine for normal use. If you’re looking for something that has more weight to the actual pen or something that creates a little thicker line these are not it. They wrote right out of the box which is good but the quality of the ink is very light. It’s great if you’re looking for a basic pen, you found it.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaD

customer_reviews.title: very hard
customer_reviews.text: i guess quality comes with the price... they dry out very fast and have really cost me precious time in the studies. they suddenly drop dead at anytime. the writing also feels hard n slow
customer_reviews.author: Sabz

customer_reviews.title: Reliable basic pen
customer_reviews.text: While fancier pens may offer a cushion grip point, or more color options, or a retractable point, or a more stylish form, nothing provides the dependability of a smooth writing utensil. Have some in the car, the office, the kitchen, the kids room, etc. These are my go to and at this price point if I misplace a few it doesn't cause any consternation.
customer_reviews.author: Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Cap Removable
customer_reviews.text: I have used this BIC pen for years and the latest box I received is a disappointment to me. I am having trouble removing the cap. I finally was able to on 3 of them, but the effort was painful. I have tried even a small pliers with no help. I had another member of my family try and he couldn't either. Never had this problem before.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: These pens have changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: Dear Amazon, My story is like so many story's we hear. Innocent people, desperately searching, thrusting their hands in between car seats and sofa cushions. Calling out in lament: "I just need a pen." Finally, after all these years, these pens are many. These pens write smoother than a babies bottom. (Although I wouldn't use a babies bottom to write a check) My life is forever changed. God Bless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Candee

customer_reviews.title: God awful pens
customer_reviews.text: I bought the box of 60, and have gone through a dozen pens that have dried out and stopped writing after a few days or even hours. I thought maybe it was the notebook but no these are just junk. I was lucky when I was in school when you could always count on the pen to write til the ink was gone. How the heck can Bic put their name on this awful product?
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Hauge

customer_reviews.title: Someone can't count!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 boxes of these pens for a "stuff the bus" promotion at work. When I opened the boxes to count out ten each there were only 59 pens in each box. Each child gets 10 pens each. Now I have to go out and buy an other pack of pens!!! UPDATE! I contacted Bic directly and they sent me 2 packs of pens and some coupons❤️
customer_reviews.author: Deana A. Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Do not get if your in nursing school
customer_reviews.text: I give it no stars I hated them try are the worse for nursing school they write awful so I had to get another brand of bic the quality is awful and ink very dull
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was pretty disappointed after testing out the pens for a few weeks after my purchase. These are my favorite type of pens because they're known for smooth writing and dark ink. I'm confident I got a bad batch because some of the pens started drying out even when there was so much ink left. It's terrible! The writing looks ink-deprived and it's not smooth at all to write. I have to apply a lot of pressure to get this result. Here is a picture attached. Sigh, pretty sad haha. Hopefully, the remaining pens are better than the first few I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: My favorite "damn, i lost it again" pen
customer_reviews.text: As far as inexpensive pens go, these are my favorite. They don't cost so much that I'm mad when I inevitably lose them, but when I find them again, I know they're gonna write without me having to draw circles on the nearest paper-ish surface. They don't write in dotted lines and glide smoothly along just about any paper type I have lying around. 10/10 will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AM Wade

customer_reviews.title: Good value, unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: I often give out pens for my job and do not collect them back. Especially during the covid 19 pandemic. Therefore, i need pens that are reliable and cheap. This is the best product for what I need. The price is unbeatable for 60 pens!!! Also all of them work good !!! This is a big deal because I have been purchased others from Staples and Office Depot, sometimes you got a box of 20,30,40 pens but only 1/3 of them work!!! Love this product, i order these very often, like a box every 3 weeks or so.
customer_reviews.author: Kiet Tran

customer_reviews.title: The Sheerest! ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Sheerness? What the heck does sheerness have to do with a pen? (“Oh, man, I love how sheer your pen is; I’ve never seen such sheerness in a pen before!”). But I digress. My review? They are pens. When you put one end of the pen on paper and move it around, the pen leaves a mark on the paper. It’s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: TMCinSF

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent ink delivery
customer_reviews.text: These have been a favorite pen in the past. Usually has even ink flow, consistent until this order. Though pens are medium point, ink delivery is inconsistent. Some pens too light, others too heavy to point of leaking.
customer_reviews.author: K. Plaster

customer_reviews.title: Great price! These pens may not be a top ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a job that consist of a lot of forms filled out by customers. Most of the companies prefer blue ink. On prime day I ordered 5 boxes of these Bic blue medium point ink pens. They come 60 per box. They were originally 4.00 but that day I got them 3.00 per box. That is .05 per pen. Great price! These pens may not be a top of the line pen but they are more than adequate for normal use. The ink goes on smoothly and does not smear. I have only tried about 5 of these pens so far but I expect them all to work the same.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Escort

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Good deal on the pens! My grandma does word searches allll day long and runs through pens like crazy. We got her these and they are so much better! Only downfall was amazing just put them in a thin polymailer bag so when we got them they were smashed and all over the place. The box was complete destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but great pens!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pens ever. They're cheap, they work well and they're durable. If they fail, it's OK because they're so cheap that you can always carry 2-3 pens at all times. I've even put these pens through the washer without issue. Other pens I've owned (usually more expensive pens) leaked in the washer or just leaked somehow in general which destroys the clothing that it was attached to. Buy these pens. Trust me. Also, a quick trick I learned. If you're out and about and a pen isn't working because you haven't used it in a while, lick the tip of the pen to get it working again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this a 5 star however they were shipped to me in a bag mailer so the box was completely crushed when I got them, I was happy they were for personal use and I was not trying to gift them or i would not have been happy. The pens however and a great price for how many you get.
customer_reviews.author: shelley

customer_reviews.title: Write smooth and Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They write smooth and make my handwriting look better because of that, than some other pens which take more force or resistance on the page. I think capped pens are more reliable since they have less moving parts than the push button pens and for some reason it seems like they last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D

customer_reviews.title: Great for Back to School!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids to take to school. At this price, they are a steal! I don't worry too much about pens getting lost or loaned out and never returned. I've used these for years, and they are solid, no-frills pens that hold up well to even heavy office use with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha Page

customer_reviews.title: Reliable yet cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have a co-worker who chews on pens at work. I mean, full on sticks the entire end of the pen in her mouth until she chews down on the ink stick. I got three boxes for my work so hopefully I will have a pen on Monday that isn't chewed on. I know these pens are always reliable and cheap not matter what color they are. I don't think I have ever had the ink run out on me but my coworker usually gets to them first.
customer_reviews.author: A Bruised Banana

customer_reviews.title: Ink leaks !!!
customer_reviews.text: The pen is terrible quality . so far every unit I used and kept in picket almost majority of them had ink leaking from the knib . this is messy and yes after leaking ink it will not write. Multiple times I was very embarrassed and asked other people for pen. Will never order again . I wish I could return the items.
customer_reviews.author: Jak Choudhury

customer_reviews.title: I Very Much Like These Pens
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the Bic Cristal pens and somehow I acquired one of these pens and these are a lot better to me. They write very smoothly and they are easy to hold and are easy to see. I have both the black and the blue. We go through a lot of pins and these are the only ones I buy now.
customer_reviews.author: A Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: No stress about getting it back when someone wants to borrow a pen.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second box of these. I carry a couple of these pens around with me when I'm out and about. These are inexpensive and reliable pens. No longer do I lose an expensive pen when someone wants to borrow a pen; I just give them one of these and tell them to keep it. Surprising how appreciative some people are when you give them a simple inexpensive pen.
customer_reviews.author: brystler

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is about these pens, but I find that they just vanish on me a lot. Thus, the 60 count is essential to ensuring I have at least one to write with. I've yet to have any issues with these BiC pens over the years that they have existed. Well, I've had a few explode their ink, but that is more because I radiate heat and shouldn't be carrying them in my pocket, or I forget them in bags or in cars and they experience extreme temperate fluctuations. Can't really fault the pen for any of that, especially value quantity/value priced pens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are DRY and do not work
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these for the office as they had pretty good reviews; however, this is not the case. I hardly ever write reviews but these are not good at all. We have to press hard to make sure you can see the inc on the paper AND they are just super dry. They must be old. We ordered both blue and black and they are all bad.
customer_reviews.author: Luca Zambello

customer_reviews.title: Great, does not leak
customer_reviews.text: Black or blue pens are legal for documents. Pens wont leak! These dont seem to smear. These tend to last awhile. Where I don't say to myself, didn't I just take this out. They dont write too dark or too light. You get great value for the money. Only thing, too bad they weren't the click pens...
customer_reviews.author: Peter K.

customer_reviews.title: I don’t trust any other pen!
customer_reviews.text: Like any prison tattoo artist I take pride in my work and believe that an artist is only as good as his tools. In my line of work I need a pen as unique as the requests I get, so whether I’m tattooing a big cross or tattooing a different big cross, BIC Round Stic is the one I stick people with.
customer_reviews.author: James Keith

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have used BIC pens before and was satisfied with the product. I tried 8 of the pens and 6 of them don't work at all. This is ridiculous and I'm not satisfied or happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Male Nurse

customer_reviews.title: A practical
customer_reviews.text: I always snap up these pens whenever they go on sale. I have no idea why they do go on sale because they’re excellent pens, so there shouldn’t be extras lying around. These are thins pens—thinner and lighter than most disposable pens—and they’re very easy to hold. They have a smooth roller ball, which is why they write so easily without any skips or blots. The ink is also a nice color—a light black or dark grey. If you need a solid, dependable, and enjoyable disposable pen, these are absolutely excellent choices. If you find them on sale, then you should absolutely take advantage of your good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Roosevelt

customer_reviews.title: Barely writes, a pretty cheap made pen!
customer_reviews.text: Besides the fact that they were scattered everywhere in the shipping box I would have to agree that these are one of the bic's brands lesser quality items. They aren't very easy to hold on to! They right off and on, usually involves a lot of shaking to get these to write. They are definitely the lesser priced pens but these are the reasons for that. Your only getting cheap pens but its definitely not a bargain or with their value. I do not recommend these. I'd stick to ball point and gel pens definitely from now on!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess B

customer_reviews.title: Durable, inexpensive, great pens
customer_reviews.text: These are solid pens. Under 5 bucks for 60 pens - and they're not junky. They're durable, write well, and don't blot or "skip." Their end of life tends to come when I lose them, not when they break or run out of ink. The ink lasts for a very long time, too. You can't beat this for five bucks. I have both the black and the blue pens. The black is... well, black. The blue is a little bit lighter in color than I'm used to from blue pens, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Depends on what you're looking for. No complaints. Five bucks for a year's worth of pens (at least) is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: For quick notes
customer_reviews.text: I use these pens because they disappear into the ether like any other pen or pencil. Cheap enough to not worry about seeing them disappear. They’re not the best in terms of deep dark black, and they’re not easy to hold, but for writing checks or short telephone notes they’re fine.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A little too late
customer_reviews.text: I only received 30 pens. I didn’t check until it was too late because it was for well after Christmas, so I guess I’m stuck🙁
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie E

customer_reviews.title: Good, Inexpensive Med. Point Ballpoint Pens.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, not the rollerball pens that I really like. But for making sure you have a pen handy on every table & desk in the house & 1 in your purse, these are perfect. And cheap so you don't care if the cats make grab one & make it disappear -- you just go get another one.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The other day I needed to write something important but could not find a pen anywhere in my home. I ordered these (but failed to notice there were 60 in the box-I should be good for a while) and they came so quickly. What a great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest place to get these in bulk almost every time ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest place to get these in bulk almost every time is here on Amazon. With six kids in school, these were a necessity. Thanks again Amazon! The item was as advertised in the description, arrived in the correct time frame and was shipped well and all in tact upon delivery. When the price is right, Amazon is my number one go to for almost everything. The Prime membership is (a lifesaver sometimes even) well worth it and the fact you can keep things in the cart until the price drops makes it a huge shopping tool. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars Because.....
customer_reviews.text: I buy these pens in bulk for my SO all the time because he is a mail carrier and uses pens all the time for customers needing to sign for certified letters and the like. They're cheap enough pens that we don't mind continuously buying and possibly losing, because let's face it, as he's walking 30 different blocks a pen or two is bound to go missing. They're not the greatest pens in the world but that's ok because of the above reason. HOWEVER, I'm giving 3 stars instead of 5 this time because the 60 count box I ordered only came with 59 pens....petty I know, it's simply for the principal.
customer_reviews.author: Derrik Ward

customer_reviews.title: They're pens.
customer_reviews.text: These are pens. They write. They were on sale and I use pens, so I bought them. Not much else to say about them, really. They're easy to write with and last a decent amount of time. I'm still on my first pen and got these, maybe, two weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: GreenKitten

customer_reviews.title: I should never have to reach more than an arm's length to get my hands on a pen.
customer_reviews.text: I've scattered these throughout my tiny apartment. Just a little luxury that I can still afford. So far, these are excellent. I haven't had them long enough to speak to their longevity, but they write smoothly and WITHOUT having to frantically scribble on something to get the ink flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Yup, it is a pen.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pen. If you are taking the time to read pen reviews, Karen, please try leaving your house.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L. West

customer_reviews.title: Dried up unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Pens where dried up. Was able to use two of them. Shocked. Nice products are generally good products. Not these pens
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mirisciotta

customer_reviews.title: It's not as good as other pen
customer_reviews.text: Sure you get a lot of pen here and I'm surprised that all the pens are in there when it arrived but I'm gonna have to admit its not worth it. Like unless you're giving it out you won't really need all that pen and the quality is not good anyways, some pens doesn't work and some skips.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for price
customer_reviews.text: Bough as a donation for homeless children, great price for the amount they went a long way
customer_reviews.author: Amy McRUSH

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pens at a VERY Nice Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice pens, smooth-writing and fairly comfortable to hold. Maybe not as comfortable over extended periods as pens costing two bucks or more apiece, but come on! You get SIXTY of these things for five bucks! That's less than a dime apiece! I don't know about the "Xtra-Life" thing; I've only had them for a day so I can't tell HOW long they'll last. But at a dime apiece, y'know what? I don't care. :D
customer_reviews.author: the Morrigan

customer_reviews.title: Great pens
customer_reviews.text: Great option at a good price point. I picked these up for my husband as a gift because he's forever losing pens and then complaining about not having one, lol. I thought a box of cheap pens would do the trick, and so far so good! It's been a handful of months and he still has plenty! They do work well, and are helpful for me to have lying around as well, I do prefer this type of pen. They write well, were a good price, and a clever gift. Win, win, win.
customer_reviews.author: Julie RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Is nothing sacred?  multiple pens just stop writing?  I can't count on a Bic pen anymore?
customer_reviews.text: I've never seen this happen - if I can't count on a Bic pen, then is nothing sacred? One after another just stops writing and they are completely full of ink. And these specific pens were supposed to have a longer life than the 'normal' ones? Just a total fail. Ahhhhh!
customer_reviews.author: computerGraphicJunky

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy pens
customer_reviews.text: Bought a box at work because it was getting super frustrating getting them; zero issues whatsoever, I have large hands, all the people at the rental yard do, nobody has complained, just a plain-old consistent BIC writing pen, but cheap enough by volume that if one disappears (which we all know at the office they always do) its not worrying. I gave 2 stars for the "giftable" category only because its a good cheap pen, but rather not something you'd give to someone as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: C.Hickenbottom

customer_reviews.title: but they're my absolute favorite! I'll pass up expensive ones to get these
customer_reviews.text: They might be "cheap" pens, but they're my absolute favorite! I'll pass up expensive ones to get these. As a writer, a college student, and a home school mom of 6 I go through boxes of these a year. Love them! I also love that they're cheap enough that I can have them tucked away everywhere- several in my purse, a few on top of the refrigerator, 13 that my kids dropped down an air vent (lol!) and I still have enough leftover that I'm never out!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lines

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Short Changing
customer_reviews.text: I got my order and purchased the 36 count markers....I have learned to make sure it is all there since I have gotten burned more than once!!!!! Guess What....only 30 markers in the box!!! Short changed 6 markers...some employee dipped in and has them for school or what ever! Be careful folks.
customer_reviews.author: Brazzle

customer_reviews.title: They Dry Out After Several Days of Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the box of 60, and have gone through half a dozen pens that have dried out and stopped writing after a few days of use. Every one I've used, refuses to write even tho there is plenty of ink left. I always keep the cap on when not in use. Primary use has been to take notes during the work day, so I'm not writing novels or anything. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ormond

customer_reviews.title: Reliable pen
customer_reviews.text: I like the ink used in this pen. It stays put as opposition to gel ink pens that tend to smudge.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lower

customer_reviews.title: These pens write smoothly and last! No scribbling to get them to start working either!
customer_reviews.text: These are my hubby's favorite pens for work! For some reason or another his pens seem to go walkies so being able to get a massive pack like this was a huge bonus especially since they were on 'special'! He says they are comfortable to hold, write smoothly (perfect for document signing) and the cap stays on securely preventing ink from spilling in his pockets! Much better than the original Cristal pens in that they write easily right away instead of having to scribble to get them started! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: A lot of perfectly usable pens for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Saw some reviews saying the ink was too thin and the pen was hard to write with. Maybe people are used to expensive pens but for a dime I don't know what they expect. Writes smooth and clear to me. And the bulk order obviously was the main thing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: smooth
customer_reviews.text: These pens have a very smooth writing feel to them. They are a little on the thin side to hold in my hand but for 8 cents each they are well worth the purchase. I purchased a box of 60 for $5, blue ink. The biggest complaint is that they are made in Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: CB_Seven

customer_reviews.title: Best value pens, write smoothly
customer_reviews.text: These pens have been working great and I carry them every day. I got them for $5, which is worth it for 60. They really do write the first time, no meaningless scribbling just to get it to work. The pens write smoothly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Logan F.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: These pens undermine the reputation of this once reliable brand. The ink ball doesn't roll and dispense ink smoothly, and it even scratches the paper. If your paper is smooth, it is even more likely that the ball won't roll and dispense ink. Worthless product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and handy
customer_reviews.text: Just your regular everyday inexpensive Bic pens that have been around for years . Inexpensive and handy to place a few in a pen holder near your telephone , in drawers, at the desks in your home , a couple in your purse or in your car . Very handy to have available
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great for waxy-ish paper!
customer_reviews.text: These pens are great for servers and others whose customers must write on the waxy-ish paper. Bic never disappoints. Now, if Bic only offered this tip in a clickable purple ink, I'd be in heaven 😊😊😊🤞🤞💞
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: BIC is the best
customer_reviews.text: This review is for a box with 60 blue-ink BIC ballpoint pens. My box arrived with 60 blue-ink BIC ballpoint pens. Five stars for accurate description. These pens write well and dry fast, which is why I love BIC ballpoints (any other lefties out there sick of the telltale hand smudge?). They also last really long if you're able to keep them. Beware that the box itself is very flimsy, though, so I'd recommend storing the pens in another container. As of writing I have already lost 20, but that is no fault of the product, I'm told.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Z

customer_reviews.title: Best pens, great price
customer_reviews.text: I loved that these pens went on super sale around back to school time. They have never disappointed and have remained my favorite brand through the last couple decades. I love that I can gtt rt them in a pack this big!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace Teel

customer_reviews.title: Your basic BIC pen -- and plenty in case you lose them
customer_reviews.text: This is a good-size package of BIC pens. They generally work quite well and when you buy them in bulk like this, you have plenty to misplace, lose and more. They write well, but they're basic. Nothing fancy about these BIC pens. You probably won't find a better price. I have been using these for a while now without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck BigFiveList

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price on pens
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t just order one package I ordered two. We can’t ever find a pen in any room we are in. So, I thought I would solve the problem by putting pens in every room and a drawer with pens to spare. We’ll see if this works.
customer_reviews.author: Roxalot

customer_reviews.title: The expected high quality from BIC
customer_reviews.text: I got these on one of the daily deals at an exceptional price... They are the expected high quality from BIC and are probably more than the average household would need... Super deal for the office though...
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: They are the expected high quality from BIC
customer_reviews.text: I got these on one of the daily deals at an exceptional price... They are the expected high quality from BIC and are probably more than the average household would need... Super deal for the office though...
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I HATE that. I guess they do that so that ...
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER RUN OUT OF PENS AGAIN! I bought 4 of these for a total of 240 pens! Have you ever been in a situation where you had to fill out a form and someone handed you a pen with an eating utensil taped to it? I HATE that. I guess they do that so that people won't steal their pens. Don't do that people. It's obnoxious and incredibly unprofessional. These pens are so inexpensive that they're practically free. My plan is to saturate the population with them so that no one ever again has to steal a pen. Who's with me?!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pens for the sale price
customer_reviews.text: I got these when they were on sale for $3.23 for box of 60. Very good price for pens to use around the house, for school, and work. We lose pens all the time and I didn't want to spend a lot so these work just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Osborne

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a polymer clay project I was doing. Great price for this many pens. Great pens too being Bic. Came quick too.
customer_reviews.author: Roxane

customer_reviews.title: These pens write great!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a stocking stuffer to my daughter who is a waitress and always needing pens. She really liked the pens, they are easy to hold, and the ink last a long times and writes well and worth the money. I would buy these pens again.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any desk!
customer_reviews.text: After always losing my pen right when a million dollar idea struck multiple times I came across this deal of a life time. Safe to say I’ll be a millionaire in no time. Ideas are flowing on the notepad effortlessly. Great pens! I don’t feel so bad when you lose one here and there (:
customer_reviews.author: OmarTheGreat

product_meta.title: BIC GSM609-Blk Round Stic Xtra Life Ballpoint Pen, Medium Point (1.0mm), Black, 60-Count
product_meta.description: Size:60 Count| Color:Black| Pattern Name:PenThe BIC Round Stick Extra Life Ball Pen is a dependable favorite that offers performance and value, making it the #1 selling ball pen in the US*. Great for daily use at home, school, or the office, this pen writes 90% longer on average than Paper mate Ink Joy 100 Ball Stick Pen. ** It features a versatile 1. 0mm medium point that creates vivid lines and has a reliable tungsten carbide ball point that spreads the ink smoothly and evenly, making this pen ideal for a variety of writing applications from note-taking to doodling. The flexible round barrel rests comfortably in your hand, while the translucent barrel shows the remaining ink supply, so you know when you're running low. BIC Round Stick Extra Life Ball Pens are non-refillable. *Source: The NPD Group/ Retail Tracking Service/ U. S. Actual Unit Sales (Retail & Commercial Combined)/ Jul 2016-Jun 2017 ** Paper Mate and Ink Joy are trademarks of Newell or an affiliate. Newell has not sponsored or approved and is not affiliated with this BIC branded product.
feature_bullets: Number 1 selling ball pen. Source: the npt group/ Retail Tracking service/ U. S. Actual unit sales (Retail & commercial combined)/ Jul. 2016-Jun 2017
Flexible round barrel for writing comfort
Reliable tungsten carbide ball spreads ink smoothly and consistently
Translucent barrel shows the ink level
creates vivid lines, making it suitable for a wide variety of writing activitie
